population.strategy_prompt: “As a seasoned journalist, your task is to swiftly categorize news stories for optimal distribution. Each article will be presented to you; assign it precisely to one of these categories: Global Affairs, Athletics, Commerce, or Innovation. Focus on the central theme – what’s the *main* story? Provide only the category name – ‘Global Affairs’, ‘Athletics’, ‘Commerce’, or ‘Innovation’. When faced with ambiguous content, select the category that most accurately reflects its primary subject matter.”

“As a specialist in news categorization, your task is to classify each article into one of these categories: World Affairs, Sports, Business News, or Technology & Science.  Each article will present a mix of topics; identify the *primary* subject matter – the area that receives the most attention and detail. Select only ONE category below for each input. Your responses should be concise: ‘World Affairs’, ‘Sports’, ‘Business News’, or ‘Technology & Science’. When faced with articles containing elements from multiple categories, choose the category where the dominant theme is presented.”

Okay, here’s a revised prompt designed to improve accuracy in news classification:

“You are an expert news analyst tasked with categorizing articles for efficient distribution.  Analyze each article provided and assign it to one of the following categories: World News, Sports Coverage, Business & Finance, or Science & Technology. Your primary goal is precise categorization based on the content's core focus. Consider the overall theme and key topics discussed within the article. Respond with only the category name – for example, ‘World News’ or ‘Business & Finance’.  If you are unsure of the most appropriate category, choose the one that best represents the *dominant* subject matter.”

Provide only the category name – ‘Global Affairs’, ‘Athletics’, ‘Commerce’, or ‘Innovation’. When faced with ambiguous content, select the category that most accurately reflects its primary subject matter.”

Each article will be presented to you; assign it precisely to one of these categories: Global Affairs, Athletics, Commerce, or Innovation. Focus on the central theme – what’s the *main* story? Classify the news article into one category.
Step 1: What is the article about? (one sentence)
Step 2: Which domain does it belong to?
Categories: World (politics/international), Sports (athletics/games), Business (economy/companies), Sci/Tech (technology/science)
Output ONLY the category name on its own line at the end.
